IMAGE REFERENCES
Character references:

  - Hegseth — Usage: Use this image only for the character’s facial identity and expression; do not copy clothing, background, or other details literally.

STYLE
Core Style:
- Render domain: Comic Illustration
- Genre / subject focus: Slice of Life
- Visual influences: American Comic

Line & Detail:
- Detail level: Highly Detailed

Color & Lighting:
- Lighting style: Soft, Even Light
- Color palette: bold_colors
- Saturation: medium

Rendering Technique:
- Shading: Cel Shading
- Texture treatment: Smooth / Clean
- Surface finish: Matte Finish

Composition & Camera:
- Camera style: Cinematic Framing
- Focal length / lens feel: Normal Lens Feel

Mood & Atmosphere:
- Mood keywords: Whimsical

Caricature & Exaggeration:
- Exaggeration level: Strong caricature
- Head-to-body exaggeration: Noticeably oversized head (cartoon proportion)
- Eye exaggeration: Large, highly expressive eyes
- Mouth exaggeration: Large, highly expressive mouth
- Eyebrow exaggeration: Bold, highly expressive eyebrows
- Jaw / chin exaggeration: Strong, stylized jawline or chin
- Elastic shape distortion: Highly elastic, cartoon-like forms
- Intentional asymmetry: Strong, intentional asymmetry
- Silhouette exaggeration: Strong, stylized silhouette
- Expression exaggeration: Highly expressive, theatrical
- Likeness preservation: Very strong likeness preservation
- Line style: Expressive hand-drawn lines

CHARACTERS

CHARACTER — Hegseth - Satire

TASK
Hegseth in a bathtub, no shirt, wearing a camouflage pattern bath cap, with an evil smirk on his face, using a toy missile to attack a toy fishing boat in the bath tub, water is splashing out of the tub. A rubber duck shields it eyes with it's wings form the horror it sees. 3 generals peer in through the bathroom door, very concerned about what they see.

TEXT ELEMENTS
- SFX: Text: Sploosh! | Style: Design a bold comic-style SFX text element.
- Text: Use short, punchy onomatopoeia like "BAM!", "CRACK!", or "WOW!" that matches the action.
- Lettering: Thick, uppercase letters with a strong black outline and slight perspective or squash/stretch for impact.
- Fill color: Bright, high-contrast warm colors (yellows, oranges, reds) with optional subtle gradient.
- Background: Optional burst or radial starburst behind the letters using complementary colors.
- Effects: Consider small motion lines, sparks, or debris around the SFX to emphasize impact.
- Placement: Near the center of the action, but do not cover faces or important details.
- Speech bubble: Text: He's making an awful mess in there. | Position: Near the generals | Style: Add a clean speech bubble for dialogue.
- Bubble shape: Smooth, rounded oval or slightly irregular hand-drawn oval.
- Tail: A solid, tapered tail pointing clearly to the speaking character’s mouth.
- Line style: Medium-weight clean black outline.
- Fill color: Solid white or very light off-white; keep interior uncluttered.
- Text: Centered, legible uppercase or mixed-case lettering with good spacing.
- Placement: Near the speaker’s head without covering eyes or important facial features; avoid overlapping key SFX or scene details.
- Thought bubble: Text: Blow, blow, blow that boat, Gently down the stream, Dead men tell no tales— Facts aren’t what they seem. | Style: Add a soft thought bubble for internal monologue.
- Bubble shape: Cloud-like cluster of round, fluffy shapes.
- Tail: A dotted or bubble-tail sequence leading from the character’s head to the main bubble.
- Line style: Slightly lighter or softer black outline than speech bubbles.
- Fill color: White or very light tint; keep text clearly readable.
- Text: Centered, slightly smaller or lighter weight than speech bubble text.
- Placement: Above or slightly behind the character’s head, without intersecting the character’s face or main SFX.

Image reference: Hegseth — Character reference images.
Usage: Use this image only for the character’s facial identity and expression; do not copy clothing, background, or other details literally.
